definition: something to be taken up later in speech or writing
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to produce clouds with one turn of the hand and rain with another (idiom); fig. to shift one's ground/tricky and inconstant/to make love
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
plethora of things to tackle/multitude of loose ends/very complicated/chaotic

Feast at Hongmen/(fig.) banquet set up with the aim of murdering a guest/refers to a famous episode in 206 BC when future Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] escaped attempted murder by his rival Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3]
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
